question: Is Miller-Dieker syndrome associated with abnormalities of chromosome 1?
ideal_answer: No. Miller-Dieker syndrome is caused by a heterozygous deletion of chromosome 17p13.3 involving the genes LIS1 and YWHAE and leads to malformations during cortical development.

snippets.text: A complete ophthalmic examination is not routinely performed on infants with Miller-Dieker syndrome (MDS, chromosome 17p13.3 microdeletion).
